æœ¯è¯­å®šä¹‰

  • naturally aligned

å‚è€ƒè‡ªhttp://books.gigatux.nl/mirror/kerneldevelopment/0672327201/ch19lev1sec3.html

A variable is naturally aligned if it exists at a memory address that is a multiple of its size. For example, a 32-bit type is naturally aligned if it is located in memory at an address that is a multiple of four (that is, its lowest two bits are zero). Thus, a data type with size 2n bytes must have an address with the n least significant bits set to zero.

å½“è®¿é—®ä¸€å—Nå­—èŠ‚çš„å†…å­˜å˜é‡æ—¶ï¼Œè‹¥è®¿é—®çš„å†…å­˜åœ°å€èƒ½è¢«Næ•´é™¤ï¼Œåˆ™ç§°è¯¥å†…å­˜åœ°å€æ˜¯ naturally alignedã€‚

  • data alignment

å‚è€ƒè‡ªhttps://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_structure_alignment

Data alignment is the aligning of elements according to their natural alignment. To ensure natural alignment, it may be necessary to insert some padding between structure elements or after the last element of a structure. For example, on a 32-bit machine, a data structure containing a 16-bit value followed by a 32-bit value could have 16 bits of padding between the 16-bit value and the 32-bit value to align the 32-bit value on a 32-bit boundary. Alternatively, one can pack the structure, omitting the padding, which may lead to slower access, but uses three quarters as much memory.

Memory access granularity is the number of bytes it accesses at a time, and a memory access boundary is where each of these groups of bytes begins.

void dfs(Node* root, map<int,int>& visited) {
    // terminator
    if (!root) return;
    if (visited.count(root->val)) return;
    
    // current logic
    visited[root->val] = 1;

    // drilll down
    for (int i = 0;i < root->children.size(); ++i) {
        dfs(root->children[i], visited);
    }

}

void dfs(Node* root) {
    if (!root) {
        return;
    }

    stack<Node*> todo;
    unordered_map<int,int> visited;
    todo.push(root);

    while (!todo.empty()) {
        Node* node = todo.top();
        todo.pop();

        if (visited.find(node->val) != visited.end()) {
            continue;
        }
        visited[node->val] = 1;

        for (int i = node->children.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
            todo.push(node->children[i]);
        } 
    }
}

void bfs(Node* root) {
    if (!root) {
        return;
    }

    queue<Node*> todo;
    unordered_map<int,int> visited;
    todo.push(root);

    // æ–¹æ³•ä¸€
    while (!todo.empty()) {
        Node* node = todo.front();
        todo.pop();

        if (visited.find(node->val) != visited.end()) {
            continue;
        }
        visited[node->val] = 1;
        
        for (int i = 0;i < node->children.size(); ++i) {
            todo.push(node->children[i]);
        }
    }

    // æ–¹å¼äºŒï¼šä¸€èˆ¬æ˜¯ç”¨äºæ±‚è§£æœ€çŸ­è·¯å¾„çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§ä¸€å±‚ä¸€å±‚çš„éå†
    while (!todo.empty()) {
        int n = todo.size();
        for (int i = 0;i < n; ++i) {
            Node* node = todo.front();
            todo.pop();

            if (visited.find(node->val) != visited.end()) {
                continue;
            }
            visited[node->val] = 1;

            for (int i = 0;i < node->children.size(); ++i) {
                todo.push(node->chilren[i]);
            }
        }
    }

}

System load averages is the average number of processes that are either in a runnable or uninterruptable state. A process in a runnable state is either using the CPU or waiting to use the CPU. A process in uninter-

ruptable state is waiting for some I/O access, eg waiting for disk. The averages are taken over the three time intervals. Load averages are not normalized for the number of CPUs in a system, so a load average of 1

means a single CPU system is loaded all the time while on a 4 CPU system it means it was idle 75% of the time.

int partition(vector<int>& nums, int left, int right) {
    // éšæœºæŒ‘é€‰ä¸€ä¸ªpivotï¼Œå°½é‡é¿å…å‡ºç°o(n^2)çš„å¤æ‚åº¦
    int random_pivot_index = rand() %(right - left + 1) + left;
    swap(nums[random_pivot_index], nums[right]);
    int pivot = right;

    while (true) {
        // ä»å·¦åˆ°å³æ‰«æï¼Œç›´åˆ°é‡åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªå¤§äºpivotçš„å…ƒç´ ï¼Œä¸‹é¢çš„è¿™è¡Œä»£ç å¾ˆå…³é”®ï¼Œå®ƒå¯ä»¥ç¡®ä¿æœ€ç»ˆçš„è¿”å›æ¡ä»¶ï¼Œå³rightæ˜¯ä¸€å®šå¤§äºæˆ–ç­‰äºpivot
        while (left < right && nums[left] <= nums[pivot]) ++left;

        // ä»å³å‘å·¦æ‰«æï¼Œç›´åˆ°é‡åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªå°äºpivotçš„å…ƒç´ 
        while (left < right && nums[right] >= nums[pivot]) --right;
        if (left < right) {
            // æ»¡è¶³äº¤æ¢æ¡ä»¶ï¼Œåˆ™è¿›è¡Œäº¤æ¢
            swap(nums[left], nums[right]);
        } else {
            break;
        }
    }

    // rightæŒ‡å‘çš„å…ƒç´ æˆ–èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯pivotåº”è¯¥æ”¾çš„ä½ç½®ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æŠŠä¸¤è€…è¿›è¡Œäº¤æ¢
    swap(nums[pivot], nums[right]);
    return right;
}

void quickSort(vector<int>& nums, int left, int right) {
    if (left >= right) return;
    int pi = partition(nums, left, right);
    quickSort(nums, left, pi - 1);
    quickSort(nums, pi + 1, right);
}

    vector<int> tmp(right - left + 1);

    // å·¦è¾¹æ’åºå¥½çš„æ•°ç»„
    int leftArrMin = left;

    int rightArrMax = right;
    int rightArrIdx = rightArrMin;

    int tmpIdx = 0;

    // ä»ä¸¤ä¸ªå·²ç»æ’åºå¥½çš„æ•°ç»„ï¼Œä¼˜å…ˆæŠŠè¾ƒå°çš„å…ƒç´ æ”¾åˆ°ä¸´æ—¶æ•°ç»„tmpé‡Œ
    while (leftArrIdx <= leftArrMax && rightArrIdx <= rightArrMax) {
        tmp[tmpIdx++] = nums[leftArrIdx] < nums[rightArrIdx] ? nums[leftArrIdx++] : nums[rightArrIdx++];
    }

    // å¦‚æœå‘ç°å·¦è¾¹çš„æ•°ç»„æ²¡æœ‰å¡«å……å®Œï¼Œåˆ™æŠŠå‰©ä¸‹çš„å…ƒç´ ä¾æ¬¡å¡«å……åˆ°ä¸´æ—¶æ•°ç»„tmpé‡Œ 
    while (leftArrIdx <= leftArrMax) {
        tmp[tmpIdx++] = nums[leftArrIdx++];
    }

    // å¦‚æœå‘ç°å³è¾¹çš„æ•°ç»„æ²¡æœ‰å¡«å……å®Œï¼Œåˆ™æŠŠå‰©ä¸‹çš„å…ƒç´ ä¾æ¬¡å¡«å……åˆ°ä¸´æ—¶æ•°ç»„tmpé‡Œ
    while (rightArrIdx <= rightArrMax) {
        tmp[tmpIdx++] = nums[rightArrIdx++];
    }

    // æœ€åä¸€æ­¥ï¼Œå°†å½’å¹¶å¥½çš„ä¸´æ—¶æ•°ç»„tmpçš„æ‰€æœ‰å…ƒç´ ä¾æ¬¡æ‹·è´åˆ°åŸæ•°ç»„ä¸­
    for (tmpIdx = 0, leftArrIdx = left; tmpIdx < tmp.size(); ) {
        nums[leftArrIdx++] = tmp[tmpIdx++];
    }
}



void mergeSort(vector<int>& nums, int left, int right) {
    if (left >= right) return;
    int mid = left + (right - left) / 2;
    mergeSort(nums, left, mid); // å·¦è¾¹çš„æ•°ç»„è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
    mergeSort(nums, mid + 1, right); // å¯¹å³è¾¹çš„æ•°ç»„è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
    merge(nums, left, mid, right); // å°†ä¸Šè¿°å·²ç»æ’å¥½åºçš„æ•°ç»„è¿›è¡Œåˆå¹¶
}

// ä»iåˆ°maxåšä¸€æ¬¡æ’åº
void heapify(vector<int>& nums, int i, int max) {
    
    while (i < max) {
        int largest = i;
        int leftChild = 2 * i + 1;
        int rightChild = 2 * i + 2;

        if (leftChild < max && nums[largest] < nums[leftChild]) {
            largest = leftChild; 
        }

        if (rightChild < max && nums[largest] < nums[rightChild]) {
            largest = rightChild;
        }

        // æ­¤æ—¶è¯´æ˜ä»iåˆ°maxçš„æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹å·²ç»æ»¡è¶³å¤§é¡¶å †ï¼Œå¯ä»¥é€€å‡º
        if (largest == i) {
            break;
        }

        // èµ°åˆ°è¿™é‡Œï¼Œè¯´æ˜å·¦å­©å­æˆ–è€…æœ‰å­©å­æ¯”çˆ¶äº²èŠ‚ç‚¹å¤§ï¼Œè¿™æ—¶éœ€è¦ç»§ç»­å¾€ä¸‹éå†ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰éœ€è¦äº¤æ¢ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶æ›´æ–°i
        swap(nums[largest], nums[i]);
        i = largest;
    }
}

void buildMaxHeap(vector<int>& nums) {
    // è‡ªåº•éƒ¨å‘ä¸Šï¼Œå…ˆæ‰¾åˆ°æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªparent
    int parent = nums.size() / 2 - 1;

    while (parent >= 0) {
        heapify(nums, parent, nums.size());

        // æŠŠæ’å¥½åºçš„èŠ‚ç‚¹å¾€ä¸Šæ
        parent -= 1;
    }
}


void heapSort(vector<int>& nums) {
    // å»ºç«‹å¤§é¡¶å †
    buildMaxHeap(nums);

    int lastElement = nums.size() - 1;

    while (lastElement > 0) {
        // nums[0]æ˜¯æœ€å¤§çš„å…ƒç´ ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æ¯æ¬¡æŠŠnums[0]ä¸æœ€åå¾…æ’åºçš„å…ƒç´ äº¤äº’
        swap(nums[0], nums[lastElement]);

        // ä¸Šé¢äº¤æ¢å®Œåï¼Œå¤§é¡¶å †çš„ç»“æ„å¯èƒ½ç ´åäº†ï¼Œè¿™æ—¶éœ€è¦åŸºäºnums[0]å†å‘ä¸‹åšä¸€æ¬¡heapify
        heapify(nums, 0, lastElement);

        // ç»§ç»­å¼€å§‹å‡†å¤‡ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªå¾…æ’åºçš„å…ƒç´ 
        lastElement -= 1;
    }
}

class Solution {
public:
    int dfs(string& beginWord, string& endWord, vector<string>& wordList) {
        // ä¸ºåŠ å¿«æ£€ç´¢é€Ÿåº¦ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œç”¨å“ˆå¸Œè¡¨æ›¿æ¢vector
        unordered_set<string> dict(wordList.begin(), wordList.end());

        // å¼‚å¸¸åˆ†æ”¯å¤„ç†ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸å­˜åœ¨è¿™æ ·çš„è§£ï¼Œåˆ™ç›´æ¥è¿”å›0
        if (dict.find(endWord) == dict.end()) {
            return 0;
        }

        queue<string> todo; // è®°å½•å¾…è®¿é—®çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹
        unordered_set<string> visited; // æ ‡è®°æ•°ç»„ï¼Œç”¨äºå­˜å‚¨å·²ç»éå†è¿‡çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹
        todo.push(beginWord);
        int ladder = 0; // è®°å½•æ±‚è§£çš„å€¼

        while (!todo.empty()) {
            int QLevelLen = todo.size();// è®°å½•è¿™ä¸€å±‚çš„æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°ï¼Œç„¶åæŒ¨ä¸ªéå†èŠ‚ç‚¹
            ++ ladder;
            for (int i = 0;i < QLevelLen; ++i) {
                string node = todo.front();
                todo.pop();

                if (node == endWord) {
                    return ladder; //æ‰¾åˆ°äº†æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œè¿”å›è®¡ç®—ç»“æœ
                }

                if (visited.find(node) != visited.end()) {
                    continue; // å·²ç»è®¿é—®è¿™ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œè·³è¿‡
                }
                visited.insert(node); // å¯¹å·²ç»è®¿é—®çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹åšä¸€ä¸‹æ ‡è®°
                
                // å¯»æ‰¾ç›¸é‚»çš„å…¶ä»–èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯æ‰¾åˆ°ä¸‹ä¸€å±‚çš„æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œå¹¶æ”¾åˆ°é˜Ÿåˆ—é‡Œ
                for (int i = 0;i < node.size(); ++i) {
                    char ch = node[i];
                    for (int k = 0; k < 26; ++k) {
                        node[i] = 'a' + k;

                        // å¦‚æœåœ¨dicté‡ŒæŸ¥æ‰¾åˆ°å¯¹åº”å…ƒç´ ï¼Œè¡¨æ˜æ‰¾åˆ°äº†è¦éå†çš„ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œæ”¾åˆ°é˜Ÿåˆ—é‡Œ
                        if (dict.find(node) != dict.end()) {
                            todo.push(node);
                        }
                    }
                    node[i] = ch;
                }
            }

        }
        // éå†æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰æ‰¾åˆ°è§£ï¼Œè¿”å›0ï¼Œå…¶å®è¿™é‡Œçš„ä»£ç ä¸ä¼šæ‰§è¡Œçš„ï¼Œå› ä¸ºåœ¨å‡½æ•°å¤´å·²ç»åšè¿‡å¼‚å¸¸å¤„ç†
        return 0;
    }

    int ladderLength(string beginWord, string endWord, vector<string>& wordList) {
        return dfs(beginWord, endWord, wordList);
    }
};

class Solution {
public:
    int dfs(string& beginWord, string& endWord, vector<string>& wordList) {
        unordered_set<string> dict(wordList.begin(), wordList.end());
        if (dict.find(endWord) == dict.end()) {
            return 0;
        }
        queue<string> head;
        queue<string> tail;
        unordered_set<string> headVisited;
        unordered_set<string> tailVisited;
        head.push(beginWord);
        tail.push(endWord);

        int ladder = 0;

        while (!head.empty() && !tail.empty()) {
            // æ¯æ¬¡éå†ï¼Œéƒ½ä»headå’Œtailä¸­æŒ‘é€‰å…ƒç´ å°‘çš„é˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œè¿™æ ·å¯ä»¥å¯èƒ½å°½å¯èƒ½çš„å°‘è®¡ç®—
            if (head.size() > tail.size()) {
                swap(head, tail);
                swap(headVisited, tailVisited);
            }

            int QLevelLen = head.size();
            for (int i = 0; i < QLevelLen; ++i) {
                string node = head.front();
                head.pop();

                // è¡¨ç¤ºä¸¤ä¸ªé˜Ÿåˆ—çš„è®¿é—®åœ¨è¯¥èŠ‚ç‚¹ç›¸é‡ï¼Œå¾—åˆ°äº†é—®é¢˜çš„è§£
                if (tailVisited.find(node) != tailVisited.end()) {
                    return ladder;
                }

                if (headVisited.find(node) != headVisited.end()) {
                    continue;
                }
                headVisited.insert(node);

                for (int j = 0; j < node.size(); ++j) {
                    char ch = node[j];
                    for (int k = 0; k < 26; ++k) {
                        node[j] = 'a' + k;
                        if (dict.find(node) != dict.end()) {
                            head.push(node);
                        }
                    }
                    node[j] = ch;
                }
            }
            // è¿™é‡Œä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦æŠŠladderåŠ ä¸€çš„æ“ä½œæ”¾åœ¨è¿™é‡Œå‘¢ï¼Ÿæ˜¯å› ä¸ºå‡ºå£åœ¨ä¸Šé¢ä¸¤é˜Ÿåˆ—ç›¸é‡çš„åœ°æ–¹
            ++ ladder;
        }
        return 0;
    }

    int ladderLength(string beginWord, string endWord, vector<string>& wordList) {
        return dfs(beginWord, endWord, wordList);
    }
};

å› ä¸ºåŒå‘bfsçš„æœç´¢ç©ºé—´æ¯”å•å‘bfsçš„å°ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ„å‘³è€…æˆ‘ä»¬åœ¨è®¿é—®æ—¶é€Ÿåº¦ä¼šæ›´å¿«ä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æœ‰ä¸€ç‚¹éœ€è¦æ³¨æ„ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œå¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬èƒ½ç¡®å®šä»èµ·ç‚¹åˆ°ç»ˆç‚¹ä¸€å®šæœ‰è§£çš„è¯ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆåŒå‘bfsä¼šæ›´å¿«ä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œå¦åˆ™åŒå‘bfså°±å˜æˆå•å‘bfsäº†ã€‚

void bfs(Node* start, Node* end) {
    if (!start || !end) {
        return;
    }

    queue<Node*> head;
    queue<Node*> tail;
    unordered_map<int,int> headVisited;
    unordered_map<int,int> tailVisited;
    head.push(start);
    tail.push(end);

    while (!head.empty() && !tail.empty()) {
        //  make sure head is the shortest size queue
        if (head.size() > tail.size()) {
            swap(head, tail);
            swap(headVisited, tailVisited);
        }

        int QLevelLen = head.size();
        for (int i = 0;i < QLevelLen; ++i) {
            
            Node* node = head.front();
            head.pop();

            if (tailVisited.find(node) != tailVisited.end()) {
                //  find solution
                return;
            }

            if (headVisited.find(node->val) != headVisited.end()) {
                continue; // already visited, skip the node
            }
            headVisited[node->val] = 1; // mark the node after being visited
            
            for (int i = 0;i < node->children.size(); ++i) {
                todo.push(node->children[i]); // add the next visited nodes
            }
        }
    }

}

class UnionFind {
public:
    UnionFind(int n) {
        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
            parent.push_back(i);
        }
        count = n;
    }

    int find(int i) {
        int root = i;
        //  find root parent
        while (parent[root] != root) {
            root = parent[root];
        }

        // path compression
        while (parent[i] != i) {
            int temp = i;
            i = parent[i];
            parent[temp] = root;
        }

        return root;
    }

    void merge(int x, int y) {
        int xRep = find(x);
        int yRep = find(y);
        if (xRep != yRep) {
            parent[xRep] = yRep;
            -- count;
        }
        return;
    }

    int getCount() {
        return count;
    }
private:
    vector<int> parent;
    int count {0};
};

å…ˆæ¥äº†è§£ä¸€ä¸‹lvalueå’Œrvalueçš„å®šä¹‰(å‚è€ƒè‡ª[1]):

An lvalue is an expression that refers to a memory location and allows us to take the address of that memory location via the & operator. An rvalue is an expression that is not an lvalue.

 // lvalues:
  int i = 42;
  i = 43; // ok, i is an lvalue
  int* p = &i; // ok, i is an lvalue
  int& foo();
  foo() = 42; // ok, foo() is an lvalue
  int* p1 = &foo(); // ok, foo() is an lvalue

  // rvalues:
  int foobar();
  int j = 0;
  j = foobar(); // ok, foobar() is an rvalue
  int* p2 = &foobar(); // error, cannot take the address of an rvalue
  j = 42; // ok, 42 is an rvalue

// move constructor
A(A&& arg) : member(std::move(arg.member)) // the expression "arg.member" is lvalue
{} 
// move assignment operator
A& operator=(A&& other) {
     member = std::move(other.member);
     return *this;
}

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;
template <typename T, typename... Args> 
T create(Args... a) {
    return T(a...);
}

class Metadata {
public:
    Metadata() {
        cout << "Metadata cstr:" << this << endl;
    }

    Metadata(Metadata& other) {
        cout << "Metadata cstr:" << this << " copy from " << addressof(other) << endl;
    }

    Metadata(Metadata&& other) {
        cout << "Metadata cstr: " << this <<" move from " << addressof(other) << endl;
    }

    ~Metadata() {
        cout << "Metadata dstr: " << this << " bye" << endl;
    }
};


int main(void)
{
    Metadata m1 = create<Metadata>(); // okay
    Metadata m2 = create<Metadata>(m1); // okay è°ƒç”¨ä¸¤æ¬¡æ‹·è´æ„é€ 
    Metadata m3 = create<Metadata>(std::move(m1)); // not okay è°ƒç”¨ä¸¤æ¬¡æ„é€ ï¼šä¸€æ¬¡æ˜¯ç§»åŠ¨æ„é€ ï¼Œå¦ä¸€æ¬¡æ˜¯æ‹·è´æ„é€ ï¼Œmoveè¯­ä¹‰æ²¡æœ‰å®ç°
    return 0;
}
